results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's [Italan version]
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett and Keith Gow
results.brief_description: Gives impressions of life and industry in Australia at the beginnings of the 1970’s with the emphasis on the potential for growth and development. Peter Weir co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Martin Von Borneman was the Director of Photography. Animation by Yoram Gross. The original production has been dubbed in Italian.

results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett, Keith Gow, David Haythornthwaite, Richard Brennan and Peter Weir
results.brief_description: Impressions of life and industry in Australia, emphasising growth and development. The emphasis is on the great potential for growth and economic development in the 1970’s. Also involved in the production are Peter Weir who co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Mick Von Borneman as Director of photography.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, Roland Beckett, Keith Gow, David Haythornthwaite, Richard Brennan and Peter Weir

results.title: Temples of time [Short Version]
results.brief_description: A mountain is a living thing; it has an ecological balance, a process of evolution manifested in slow, subtle ways; but it is also subject to the ravages of man’s technology. Filmed in the Canadian Rockies and in Garibaldi Park, this picture brings to the screen magnificent footage of mountain solitudes and the wildlife found there, of natural splendor in all its changing moods. The film carries the implicit warning that all this may pass away if people do not seek to preserve it. Film without words.

results.title: Temple on the hill
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film and Television Office, George Wallace-Crabbe and Kay Rasool
results.brief_description: The Sikh community have played a role in the Northern Australian community at Woolgoolga, New South Wales since the turn of last century. Initially coming as labourers the Sikh’s, who now have a stronghold in the community, own and run 90% of the banana plantations in the area. This documentary deals with assimilation and identity and uses the example of both a traditional and progressive Sikh family to discuss the difficulties with language, marriage and family responsibilities in changing times. As the mature generations grow old, maintaining a culture becomes increasingly difficult as the younger generations more easily are attracted to and absorbed into Australia’s western lifestyle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New South Wales Film and Television Office, George Wallace-Crabbe and Kay Rasool

results.title: Tempest
results.brief_description: Paul Mazurky’s modern day reworking of Shakespeare’s “Tempest” is an extraordinary comedy about a consumate dissatisfied man (John Cassavetes), no longer able to tolerate the compromises he has made in his stormy marriage. Cast includes Susan Sarandon, Gena Rowlands, Molly Ringwald, Raul Julia and the spectacular vistas of the Greek Isles.

results.title: Temperate rain forest
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, John Taylor, George Johnson and Don White
results.brief_description: One of a group of short films on various climatic, geographic and ecological zones in British Columbia, The Temperate Rain Forest examines the special characteristics, including the life cycle and food chain, of the northwest coastal rain forest. Its highly acidic soil results in a specialized plant community and an abundance of amphibians and reptiles. As the camera reveals, it is a place of exquisite beauty, and one that has an important place in the ecology.

results.title: Temperament unsuited
results.brief_description: The narrative explores the predicament faced by an unconventional student teacher attempting to orient himself to the conservative world of secondary school teaching. Cast includes Steve J. Spears, Robyn Nevin, Deborah Kennedy, Ken Goodlet, Peter Carroll, Jude Kuring, Paul Mason, Jenny McNae, Max Phipps, Phil Ross.

results.title: Telling the weather
results.brief_description: This documentary introduces students to a variety of basic facts about meteorology, with emphasis on the causes and effects of cold and warm fronts, the three main types of clouds, the formation of a tornado, and the origins of lightning. Discusses innovations which have improved the accuracy of foretelling the weather, and shows how the weather data compiled at several American schools assist a meteorologist in Washington DC to prepare his television forecasts. Includes a brief teacher’s guide.
